quarks.metrics

Class MetricsSetup

  • java.lang.Object
    • quarks.metrics.MetricsSetup

  • public class MetricsSetup
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility helpers for configuring and starting a Metric JmxReporter or a ConsoleReporter.

    This class is not thread safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MetricsSetup registerWith(javax.management.MBeanServer mBeanServer)
      Use the specified MBeanServer with this metric setup.
      MetricsSetup startConsoleReporter()
      Starts the metric ConsoleReporter polling every second.
      MetricsSetup startJMXReporter(java.lang.String jmxDomainName)
      Starts the metric JMXReporter.
      static MetricsSetup withRegistry(ServiceContainer services, com.codahale.metrics.MetricRegistry registry)
      Returns a new MetricsSetup for configuring metrics.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • withRegistry

        public static MetricsSetup withRegistry(ServiceContainer services,
                                        com.codahale.metrics.MetricRegistry registry)
        Returns a new MetricsSetup for configuring metrics.
        Parameters:
        registry - the registry to use for the application
        Returns:
        a MetricsSetup instance

      • registerWith

        public MetricsSetup registerWith(javax.management.MBeanServer mBeanServer)
        Use the specified MBeanServer with this metric setup.
        Parameters:
        mBeanServer - the MBean server used by the metric JMX reporter

      • startJMXReporter

        public MetricsSetup startJMXReporter(java.lang.String jmxDomainName)
        Starts the metric JMXReporter. If no MBeanServer was set, use the virtual machine's platform MBeanServer.

      • startConsoleReporter

        public MetricsSetup startConsoleReporter()
        Starts the metric ConsoleReporter polling every second.
